intro: Icacorea rigidifolia, commonly known as the rigid thornbush, is a shrub native to parts of Australia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its woody stems and thorny branches. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters, typically during the warmer months. Its leaves are simple, opposite, and often have a rough texture. Icacorea rigidifolia is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, showcasing resilience to drought and poor soil conditions.
